image.altText: A woman with glasses looking serious in front of a yellow wall

props.synopsis: Government data has revealed nearly 50 people have been charged with sexual offences against children in state care in the past two years, prompting SA's child protection watchdog to call on the government to respond more quickly when it suspects a child is at risk of sexual abuse.

title.children: Data reveals nearly 50 people have been charged with sexual offences against children in state care

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a wall in Kyiv. Behind the wall there appears to be a timber baricade

props.synopsis: Yulia was filming on her phone in Kyiv when a nearby children's hospital was struck by a Russian missile. She says it "literally looked like Armageddon".

title.children: 'I felt the blast': Kyiv resident recalls moment children's hospital was hit

image.altText: A man in handcuffs is escorted through a doorway by two policemen, with one holding him by the arm

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man has been found guilty over his involvement in an Adelaide city nightclub stabbing that left six people hospitalised, including one in a critical condition. Mathiang Malok, 25, committed aggravated affray and two counts of aggravated causing harm with intent to cause harm, a judge has found.

title.children: Melbourne man found guilty of 'clearly deliberate' and 'focused' SA nightclub stabbing

image.altText: A woman with grey hair wearing a check jacket and pearls

props.synopsis: Commissioner Ann Vanstone, who announced her resignation two days ago, says the state's integrity agency is the weakest in the country, which only benefits "those who are corrupt".

title.children: 'Weakest' ICAC in the nation benefits the corrupt, outgoing SA commissioner says

image.altText: A screen shot of Tayla's video

props.synopsis: App-based rideshare services like Uber have made it easier than ever to travel. However, users have been left unsatisfied by the lack of action after reporting inappropriate incidents.

title.children: Tayla's Uber driver behaved indecently towards her, yet she was the one left feeling 'ashamed'

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman gazes into the distance

props.synopsis: A prominent anti-violence campaigner has called on the Northern Territory government to involve community elders in discussions about strategies to quell violent unrest beyond the snap curfew.

title.children: Anti-violence campaigner says government must listen to 'voices from the bush' after Alice Springs curfew

image.altText: An older man in a suit with a bright red cap gestures as he speaks behind a lectern.

props.synopsis: The implications for what happens next in the race for the White House have ramifications that stretch far beyond US shores. And that's a key reason why Australia and China are closely watching what happens next.

title.children: Trump says he could end the Russia-Ukraine war 'within a day'. It's enough to send shivers down Australia's spine

image.altText: New Royal Adelaide Hospital from above.

props.synopsis: Families of loved ones requiring CAR T-cell therapy call on the South Australian government to follow other mainland states and set up a local clinic with severely ill patients having to travel interstate from where some do not return.

title.children: Sending patients interstate for innovative cancer therapy 'suboptimal and risky', specialist warns

image.altText: Side portrait of woman with pink and purple hair, wearing a leopard print top.

props.synopsis: Over 13 years NSW authorities received 56 reports about the welfare of Sally. She wants her story to be heard so no other little girl suffers in the same way.

title.children: Abused since age 3, it took more than 50 departmental reports and 10 years to remove Sally from that home

image.altText: Two police officers in tactical gear stand on a street with their backs to the camera

props.synopsis: A magistrate deals a fresh blow to a "weak" Commonwealth case against a suspected Sydney terrorism network, describing an alleged terror plan as "all talk" as he grants bail to a fourth teenager.

title.children: 'All talk': Court grants bail to another alleged terror plotter, branding Crown case 'weak'

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks at a podium with two microphones and points straight ahead. A door and flag are behind him.

props.synopsis: Fist fights broke out the last time the Democratic Party's presidential candidate was decided on the convention floor in 1968.

title.children: If President Joe Biden drops out of the race, what happens next?

image.altText: A close up of Joe Biden speaking passionately and pointing with his right hand

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden is facing fresh doubts about his re-election chances from heavyweights Nancy Pelosi and George Clooney, and analysts say it's likely he'll give into the pressure.

title.children: 'He'll keep digging his heels in until he doesn't': Pressure mounts on Biden to step aside

image.altText: NATO

props.synopsis: The newly elected UK prime minister shares the international podium with his European partners and meets with Joe Biden in the White House after promising to continue backing Ukraine in its fight against Russia.

title.children: Starmer draws on NATO values to 'defeat fascism' in first appearance on world stage

image.altText: Upwards shot of the BHP building in Perth.

props.synopsis: Mining giant BHP has announced it’s putting its WA nickel mines on ice for at least three years, blaming an "oversupply in the global nickel market."

title.children: Redundancies and redeployments on offer for 1,600 people as BHP shuts nickel mines

image.altText: Adam Britton stands by greenery wearing a green shirt.

props.synopsis: Animal rights activists have been left angered after the NT Supreme Court again delayed sentencing prominent crocodile expert Adam Britton.

title.children: Sentencing delayed again for zoologist Adam Britton, who abused and killed dozens of dogs

image.altText: A group of people gather

props.synopsis: First responders, families and support workers gather in Lalor Park in Sydney's south to remember three young children who died in a house fire at the weekend.

title.children: 'We wrap our arms around you': Community attends vigil for children killed in Sydney house fire

image.altText: Jye Gray of the Rabbitohs scores what is awarded as a penalty try

props.synopsis: The Dolphins have been on top of Souths at their spiritual home, but a contentious penalty try and a serious injury to Euan Aitken means they cannot rest in the second half. Follow live.

title.children: Dolphins fume as Bunnies awarded contentious penalty try

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Euan Aitken may have played his last match for the Dolphins
Contentious penalty try a major talking point from the first half

image.altText: A Sydney Swans AFL player stands next to a St Kilda opponent who is being helped by a trainer, and speaks to the other player.

props.synopsis: Sydney Swans star Isaac Heeney is ruled out of Brownlow Medal contention after the AFL appeals board confirms his one-match suspension for hitting St Kilda's Jimmy Webster.

title.children: Sydney Swans Isaac Heeney out of Brownlow Medal race as one-match ban is upheld

image.altText: Joe Biden, George Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barack Obama stand side-by-side.

props.synopsis: Just a few weeks after helping the president raise tens of millions at an LA fundraiser, George Clooney is calling on Joe Biden to step aside. It's deeply damaging on several fronts.

title.children: George Clooney's message to Biden is deeply damaging on several fronts

image.altText: A young couple pose, the man has his arm around the woman's waist

props.synopsis: A quarter of Australia's homeless are young people. While Chloe Hume and Trent Kiely are among them, a caravan by a river has offered them refuge from housing stress.

title.children: Young couple find shelter in a caravan after being left homeless in cut-throat rental market

image.altText: A woman in a light green jacket talks to police officers in dark jackets outside with trees in background.

props.synopsis: Aboriginal leaders in Geraldton are calling for cultural change within WA Police following a week of coronial hearings into the fatal shooting of a First Nations woman in the Midwest.

title.children: 'No empathy': Indigenous leaders seek greater cultural understanding from police amid fatal shooting inquest

image.altText: Catholic Archbishop of Perth Timothy Costelloe arrives for the parliamentary inquiry hearing.

props.synopsis: The Catholic Archbishop of Perth is called to intervene over the Christian Brothers decision not to attend a parliamentary inquiry into institutional child sexual abuse.

title.children: Christian Brothers pull the pin on child sex abuse inquiry appearance at 11th hour

image.altText: Two unidentified people wearing jackets with "Australian Federal Police" and "Forensics" on the back.

props.synopsis: A man released by the High Court following the NZYQ decision has been charged with breaching his visa conditions by visiting within 200 metres of a school or childcare centre on eight separate occasions.

title.children: Former immigration detainee allegedly breached conditions not to go near schools or childcare centres eight times

image.altText: Former West Coast Eagles defender Brad Sheppard standing outside of the Broome Toyota showroom.

props.synopsis: Retired footballer Brad Sheppard is suing his former club, the West Coast Eagles, the AFL as well as two doctors over claims of 'medical negligence.'

title.children: Former West Coast Eagle sues AFL for 'medical negligence' following concussion retirement

image.altText: Aerial image of the tug pens and bulk carriers at a port

props.synopsis: Four earthquakes have struck near the town of Port Hedland across the day, with Geoscience Australia saying the first was likely a "foreshock" ahead of the later 3.8-magnitude tremor and further aftershocks.

title.children: Earthquake 'swarm' strikes Port Hedland's surrounds as multiple tremors rattle the town in one day

image.altText: A little girl with a pink cap, smiling

props.synopsis: Members of a religious group charged over the death of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs spent a day and a half praying and singing over her dead body in the hope she would be raised from the dead by God, a Supreme Court trial has heard.

title.children: Members of religious group charged over death of Elizabeth Struhs prayed and sung over her body, trial hears

image.altText: A pink, furless joey the size of a jellybean can be seen as a gloved hand checks inside the pouch of a wallaby

props.synopsis: The tiny new brush-tailed rock wallaby arrivals were discovered by elated rangers during an annual check as part of a breeding program at the Barrington Wildlife Sanctuary on the New South Wales Mid North Coast.

title.children: 'Phenomenal news': Rangers find six surprise joeys in pouches of endangered rock wallabies

image.altText: Police tape across a street with a number of police cars and people in forensic suits standing next to police vehicles.

props.synopsis: The bodies of a woman in her 50s and a girl believed to be in her teens have been found inside a home in Sydney's north-west. Sources have told the ABC that investigators are uncertain of the circumstances of the deaths of the mother and daughter.

title.children: Bodies of woman and girl found in Sydney home

image.altText: Casey Dellacqua and Ash Barty playing together at 2024 Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's withdrawal from Wimbledon leaves Australian fans shattered, but Ash Barty is convinced brighter days are ahead for her compatriot, even if he is forced to miss the Paris Olympics. Here are the five quick hits from day 10 at Wimbledon.

title.children: Five quick hits: Ash Barty returns to Wimbledon on sad day for Aussie tilt as Alex de Minaur's Olympic dreams look shot

image.altText: Older lady sits at kitchen table with a mug in front of her

props.synopsis: The signs of malnutrition in older Australians might be more familiar than you think but they are often dismissed as a 'normal' part of ageing. Here's how some simple changes could help.

title.children: 'Don't skip dessert, have the ice cream': Why older people need more high-energy food than younger folk

image.altText: Andrew Cobby sits in the back of a police car.

props.synopsis: Andrew Cobby claims he suffers from untreatable migraines after an alleged assault behind bars, as he contests fraud charges separate to his murder conviction.

title.children: Convicted killer Andrew Cobby tells fraud trial he suffers 'constant pain' after prison assault

image.altText: A middle aged white man and a woman with dark curly hair pose by a round port door inside a space station

props.synopsis: A pair of US astronauts who should have been back on Earth weeks ago say they are confident that the problem-plagued Boeing Starliner capsule they rode up on can return them safely.

title.children: Astronauts stuck in space for over a month 'confident' Boeing's Starliner will bring them home

image.altText: Danielle Wood productivity commission

props.synopsis: Most Australians are economically better off than their parents when at a similar age, but that's increasingly not the case for those in poverty, women, and people born after 1990, according to the Productivity Commission.

title.children: Most of Gen X are earning more than their parents, but the picture is cloudy for Gens Y and Z

image.altText: An embossed metal sign on a building that reads "Department of Education".

props.synopsis: A "psychopathic" paedophile, who later boasted of sexually abusing 2,000 boys, was employed as a Victorian Education Department school teacher despite declaring in a 1970s job application form that he was a convicted child abuser.

title.children: 'Psychopathic' paedophile was given teaching job despite declaring abuse conviction on application
